taskDescription:
Solve the formula  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>V</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mfrac>
    <mn>1</mn>
    <mn>3</mn>
  </mfrac>
  <mi>π<!-- π --></mi>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mi>r</mi>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
  <mi>h</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">V = \frac{1}{3}\pi {r^2}h</annotation></semantics></math>. for <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>h</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">h</annotation></semantics></math>. This formula is used to calculate the volume <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>V</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">V</annotation></semantics></math> of a right circular cone with radius <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>r</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">r</annotation></semantics></math> and height <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>h</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">h</annotation></semantics></math>.
